sen.j: 穴穂部皇子（あなほべのみこ、生年不詳 - 用明天皇2年6月7日 (旧暦)（587年7月17日））は、飛鳥時代の皇族。
sen.e: Prince Anahobe (year of birth unknown - July 19, 587) is one of the Imperial family members of the Asuka period.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。
sen.e: Prince Anahobe (year of birth unknown - July 17, 587) was one of the Imperial family members of the Asuka period.
sen.cmt: 日付が間違っています。時制が違います。
sen.e: Prince Anahobe (year of birth unknown - July 19, 587) was one of the Imperial family members of the Asuka period.

sen.j: 欽明天皇の皇子、母は蘇我稲目の娘小姉君。
sen.e: He is a prince of Emperor Kinmei, and his mother is Oanenokimi, a daughter of SOGA no Iname.
He was the prince of Emperor Kinmei, and his mother was Oanenokimi, the daughter of SOGA no Iname.
He was the prince of Emperor Kinmei, and his mother was Oanenokimi, the daughter of SOGA no Iname.

sen.j: 敏達天皇の弟。
sen.e: He is a younger brother of Emperor Bidatsu.
He was the younger brother of Emperor Bidatsu.
He was the younger brother of Emperor Bidatsu.

sen.j: 皇位を望み、物部守屋と結託したが、蘇我馬子に殺された。
sen.e: He conspired with MONONOBE no Moriya to attain the Imperial Throne, but he was killed by SOGA no Umako.
He conspired with MONONOBE no Moriya to attain the Imperial Throne, but he was killed by SOGA no Umako.
He conspired with MONONOBE no Moriya to attain the Imperial Throne, but he was killed by SOGA no Umako.

tit.cmt: スタイル違犯（天皇の経歴はBackground）です。

sen.j: 敏達天皇14年（585年）8月、敏達天皇が崩御し、殯宮で敏達天皇の葬儀が行われると、穴穂部皇子は天下を欲し「何故に死する王に仕えるのか、生きる王に仕えない」と憤慨した。
sen.e: In September, 585, when Emperor Bidatsu passed away and his funeral ceremony was held in Hinkyu (funeral parlor), Prince Anahobe, who was eager to reign the whole country, said resentfully, "I don't understand why you obey the dead king, not the living one."
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。
sen.e: In September, 585, when Emperor Bidatsu passed away with his funeral ceremony held in Hinkyu (funeral parlor), Prince Anahobe was eager to reign the whole country and said resentfully: "I don't understand why you obey the dead king and not the living one."
sen.cmt: 文を自然にするため、全体を修正しました。
sen.e: In September, 585, when Emperor Bidatsu passed away with his funeral ceremony held in Hinkyu (funeral parlor), Prince Anahobe was eager to reign the whole country and said resentfully: 'I don't understand why you obey the dead king and not the living one.'
sen.cmt: クォーテーション調整

sen.j: 同年9月、穴穂部皇子ではなく大臣蘇我馬子の推す大兄皇子（用明天皇、母は蘇我稲目の娘蘇我堅塩媛）が即位した。
sen.e: In October, 585, not Prince Anahobe but Prince Oe (Emperor Yomei's son, his mother was SOGA no Katashihime, a daughter of SOGA no Iname) ascended the throne with the support of the Minister SOGA no Umako.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。
sen.e: In October 585, instead of Prince Anahobe, Prince Oe (Emperor Yomei's son, his mother was SOGA no Katashihime, the daughter of SOGA no Iname) ascended the throne with the support of the Minister SOGA no Umako.
sen.cmt: 文を自然にするため、一部修正しました。定冠詞が必要です。
sen.e: In October 585, instead of Prince Anahobe, Prince Oe (Emperor Yomei's son, his mother was SOGA no Katashihime, the daughter of SOGA no Iname) ascended the throne with the support of the Minister SOGA no Umako.

sen.j: 穴穂部皇子はこれに対抗するため連物部守屋と結んだ。
sen.e: He conspired with Muraji MONONOBE no Moriya in order to oppose the enthronement of Prince Oe.
He conspired with Muraji MONONOBE no Moriya in order to oppose the enthronement of Prince Oe.
He conspired with Muraji MONONOBE no Moriya in order to oppose the enthronement of Prince Oe.

sen.j: 用明天皇元年（586年）5月、穴穂部皇子は推古天皇（敏達天皇の皇后、「姿色端麗・進止軌制」と記される美女）を犯さんと欲し、殯宮に押し入ろうとした。
sen.e: In May, 586, Prince Anahobe tried to break into Hinkyu in order to rape Empress Suiko, who was the wife of Emperor Bidatsu, and who was so beautiful that her beauty was expressed: "fair of face and figure; well-mannered and polite."
In May 586, Prince Anahobe tried to break into Hinkyu to rape Empress Suiko (the wife of Emperor Bidatsu whose beauty was expressed as: 'fair of face and figure; well-mannered and polite.'
sen.cmt: Mayの後に不要なカンマがあります。スタイル違犯(「」は'')です。文を読みやすくするため、一部修正しています。
sen.e: In May 586, Prince Anahobe tried to break into Hinkyu to rape Empress Suiko (the wife of Emperor Bidatsu whose beauty was expressed as: 'fair of face and figure; well-mannered and polite.'

sen.j: 先帝の寵臣三輪逆は門を閉じてこれを拒んだ。
sen.e: MIWA no Sakau, a favorite retainer of ex-Emperor, refused to let him in, closing the gate.
MIWA no Sakau, a favorite retainer of the former Emperor, refused to let him in closing the gate.
sen.cmt: 定冠詞が必要です。formerの方が良いと思います。
sen.e: MIWA no Sakau, a favorite retainer of the former Emperor, refused to let him in closing the gate.

sen.j: 穴穂部皇子は七度門前で呼んだが、遂に宮に入ることができなかった。
sen.e: Although Prince Anahobe called seven times at the gate, he finally couldn't enter Hinkyu.
Although Prince Anahobe called seven times at the gate, he still couldn't enter Hinkyu.
sen.cmt: stillの方が良いと思います。
sen.e: Although Prince Anahobe called seven times at the gate, he still couldn't enter Hinkyu.

sen.j: 穴穂部皇子は蘇我馬子と物部守屋に三輪逆は不遜であると相談し、馬子と守屋は同意した。
sen.e: Prince Anahobe talked to SOGA no Umako and MONONOBE no Moriya that MIWA no Sakau was irreverent, and they agreed with him.
Prince Anahobe talked to SOGA no Umako and MONONOBE no Moriya about MIWA no Sakau being irreverent and they agreed with him.
sen.cmt: 文を自然にするため、一部修正しました。
sen.e: Prince Anahobe talked to SOGA no Umako and MONONOBE no Moriya about MIWA no Sakau being irreverent and they agreed with him.

sen.j: 守屋は兵を率い磐余池で三輪逆を包囲しようとした。
sen.e: MONONOBE no Moriya commanded his army and tried to surround MIWA no Sakau at Iware Pond.
MONONOBE no Moriya commanded his army and tried to surround MIWA no Sakau at Iware-ike Pond.
sen.cmt: 指示書（二重に訳す）に従い-ikeを追加しました。
sen.e: MONONOBE no Moriya commanded his army and tried to surround MIWA no Sakau at Iware-ike Pond.

sen.j: 三輪逆は逃れて、炊屋姫の後宮に隠れた。
sen.e: MIWA no Sakau escaped it and hid in the inner palace of Princess Kashiyaki-hime (Empress Suiko).
sen.cmt: 炊屋姫と推古天皇は同一人物なので、補足しました。
sen.e: MIWA no Sakau escaped and hid in the inner palace of Princess Kashiyaki-hime (Empress Suiko).
MIWA no Sakau escaped and hid in the inner palace of Princess Kashiyaki-hime (Empress Suiko).

sen.j: 密告により三輪逆の居所が知られ、穴穂部皇子は三輪逆とその子を殺すよう守屋に命じた。
sen.e: Prince Anahobe ordered Moriya to kill Miwa no Sakau and his children after he knew the address of Miwa no Sakau by anonymous information.
Prince Anahobe ordered Moriya to kill Miwa no Sakau and his children after he knew the address of Miwa no Sakau by anonymous information.
Prince Anahobe ordered Moriya to kill Miwa no Sakau and his children after he knew the address of Miwa no Sakau by anonymous information.

sen.j: 守屋は兵を率いて向かった。
sen.e: Moriya headed for the place where Miwa no Sakau was with his army.
Moriya headed for the place where Miwa no Sakau was with his army.
Moriya headed for the place where Miwa no Sakau was with his army.

sen.j: これを聞いた馬子は穴穂部皇子のところへ行き、門前で出会った。
sen.e: When he heard this, Umako went to see Prince Anahobe, and they met in front of the gate.
When Umako heard this, he went to see Prince Anahobe, and they met in front of the gate.
sen.cmt: 初めのheが誰なのかが不明のため、Umakoとheの位置は逆にしました。
sen.e: When Umako heard this, he went to see Prince Anahobe, and they met in front of the gate.

sen.j: 穴穂部皇子は守屋のところに行こうとしていた。
sen.e: Prince Anahobe was about to go to see Moriya.
Prince Anahobe was about to go to see Moriya.
Prince Anahobe was about to go to see Moriya.

sen.j: 馬子は王者は刑人に近づくべからずと諫言したが、穴穂部皇子は聞き入れようとしなかった。
sen.e: Although Umako remonstrated with him that the king should not become intimate with a criminal, he would not listen to it.
Although Umako remonstrated with him that the King should not become intimate with a criminal, he did not listen.
sen.cmt: kingのkを大文字に変更、文を自然にするため、一部を修正しました。
sen.e: Although Umako remonstrated with him that the King should not become intimate with a criminal, he did not listen.

sen.j: 馬子は仕方なくついて行き、磐余に至ったところで、再度諫言した。
sen.e: Umako followed him reluctantly, and he remonstrated with him again when they reached Iware.
Umako followed him reluctantly, and he remonstrated with him again when they reached Iware.
Umako followed him reluctantly, and he remonstrated with him again when they reached Iware.

sen.j: 穴穂部皇子は諫言に従い、胡床に座り守屋を待った。
sen.e: Prince Anahobe followed Umako's admonition this time, and he waited for Moriya sitting with his legs crossed.
Prince Anahobe followed Umako's admonition this time, and he waited for Moriya sitting on a kosho (stool).
sen.cmt: 胡床は下記のサイトにあるような椅子のことだと思います。http://www.shinguya.com/aibiki-kosyou.html
sen.e: Prince Anahobe followed Umako's admonition this time, and he waited for Moriya sitting on a kosho (stool).

sen.j: やがて、守屋が戻ってきて三輪逆を斬ったと報告した。
sen.e: Before long, Moriya returned and reported that he killed MIWA no Sakau by the sword.
Before long, Moriya returned and reported that he had killed MIWA no Sakau by the sword.
Before long, Moriya returned and reported that he had killed MIWA no Sakau by the sword.

sen.j: 馬子は「天下の乱は近い」と嘆いた。
sen.e: Umako was grieved to say, "The war in the world will come soon."
Umako sadly said, "The war in the world will come soon."
sen.cmt: 文を自然にするため、一部修正しました。
sen.e: Umako sadly said, 'The war in the world will come soon.'
sen.cmt: クォーテーション調整

sen.j: 守屋は「汝のような小臣の知るところにあらず」と答えた。
sen.e: Moriya answered, "A court of no importance like you will never know that."
Moriya answered, "An unimportant retainer like you will never know that."
sen.cmt: 文を自然にするため、一部修正しました。
sen.e: Moriya answered, 'An unimportant retainer like you will never know that.'
sen.cmt: クォーテーション調整

sen.j: 用明天皇2年（587年）4月2日、用明天皇は病になり仏法を信奉したいと欲し群臣に諮った。
sen.e: On May 16, 587, when Emperor Yomei fell ill, he asked a crowd of his retainers whether he would be allowed to pursue his desire to practice the Buddhism or not.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。
sen.e: On May 16, 587, when Emperor Yomei fell ill, he asked the crowd of his retainers whether he would be allowed to pursue his desire to practice Buddhism or not.
sen.cmt: 定冠詞を追加、削除しました。
sen.e: On May 16, 587, when Emperor Yomei fell ill, he asked the crowd of his retainers whether he would be allowed to pursue his desire to practice Buddhism or not.

sen.j: 排仏派の守屋は反対したが、崇仏派の馬子は詔を奉じて助けるべきとした。
sen.e: Moriya, who was an anti-Buddhist, opposed it, whereas Umako, who was a pro-Buddhist, thought he should respect the Imperial edict and help the Emperor.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Moriya, who was an anti-Buddhist opposed to it, whereas Umako, who was a pro-Buddhist, thought that he should respect the Imperial edict and help the Emperor.
sen.cmt: 不要なカンマを削除しました。toとthatが抜けています。
sen.e: Moriya, who was an anti-Buddhist opposed to it, whereas Umako, who was a pro-Buddhist, thought that he should respect the Imperial edict and help the Emperor.

sen.j: そこで彼は、穴穂部皇子に豊国法師を連れて来させた。
sen.e: Then, he had Prince Anahobe bring a Buddhist preacher named Toyokuni to the Emperor.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Then, he had Prince Anahobe bring a Buddhist preacher named Toyokuni to the Emperor.
Then, he had Prince Anahobe bring a Buddhist preacher named Toyokuni to the Emperor.

sen.j: 守屋は自分が推していた穴穂部皇子が法師を連れてきたことに大いに怒り睨みつけた。
sen.e: Moriya was mad at Prince Anahobe and glared at him because Prince Anahobe took a Buddhist preacher to the Emperor in spite of his backup.
Moriya was mad at Prince Anahobe and glared at him because Prince Anahobe, who was supported by Moriya, took a Buddhist preacher to the Emperor.
sen.cmt: 文を自然にするため、一部修正しました。
sen.e: Moriya was mad at Prince Anahobe and glared at him because Prince Anahobe, who was supported by Moriya, took a Buddhist preacher to the Emperor.

sen.j: その後、守屋は群臣から命を狙われていると知らされて、別業の阿都（河内国）へ退いた。
sen.e: After that, Moriya retired to villa Ato, Kawachi Province to hear from his retainers that he was sought the life.
Later, Moriya retired to villa Ato (Kawachi Province) after hearing from his retainers that somebody was trying to kill him.
sen.cmt: 文を自然にするため、全体を修正しました。
sen.e: Later, Moriya retired to villa Ato (Kawachi Province) after hearing from his retainers that somebody was trying to kill him.

sen.j: 同年4月9日、用明天皇は崩御した。
sen.e: On May 23, 587, Emperor Yomei passed away.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。
sen.e: On May 23, 587, Emperor Yomei passed away.
On May 23, 587, Emperor Yomei passed away.

sen.j: 後嗣が定まらず皇位は一時的に空位となった。
sen.e: The Imperial Throne became vacant temporarily since his inheritor was not decided.
The Imperial Throne became vacant temporarily since his successor was still undecided.
sen.cmt: successorの方が良いと思います。文を自然にするため、全体を修正しました。
sen.e: The Imperial Throne became vacant temporarily since his successor was still undecided.

sen.j: 同年5月、守屋は穴穂部皇子を天皇に立てんと欲し、密使を皇子に送り、遊猟に出ると欺いて淡路へ来るよう願った。
sen.e: In June, 587, for Moriya tried to make Prince Anahobe an emperor, he sent a secret agent to Prince Anahobe and asked him to come Awaji, pretending to go out hunting.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。
sen.e: In June 587, Moriya tried to make Prince Anahobe an emperor, so he sent a secret agent to Prince Anahobe and asked him to come to Awaji, pretending to go out for hunting.
sen.cmt: 不要な箇所を削除し、前置詞等を修正しました。
sen.e: In June 587, Moriya tried to make Prince Anahobe an emperor, so he sent a secret agent to Prince Anahobe and asked him to come to Awaji, pretending to go out for hunting.

sen.j: 同年6月7日、蘇我馬子は炊屋姫を奉じて、佐伯連丹經手、土師連磐村、的臣眞噛に速やかに穴穂部皇子と宅部皇子を誅殺するよう詔した。
sen.e: On July 19, 587, SOGA no Umako decided to follow Kashiyaki-hime and ordered SAEKI no Muraji Nifute, HAJI no Muraji Iwamura, and IKUHA no Omi Makuhi to kill Prince Anahobe and Prince Yakabe as soon as possible.
sen.cmt: 原文「的臣眞」は、的臣眞噛（いくはのおみ まくひ）のことかと思われます。原文、訳を訂正しました。http://www009.upp.so-net.ne.jp/tocda/text/kan21.html（日本書紀21巻）
sen.e: On July 19, 587, SOGA no Umako decided to follow Kashiyaki-hime and ordered SAEKI no Muraji Nifute, HAJI no Muraji Iwamura, and IKUHA no Omi Makuhi to kill Prince Anahobe and Prince Yakabe as soon as possible.

On July 19, 587, SOGA no Umako decided to follow Kashiyaki-hime and ordered SAEKI no Muraji Nifute, HAJI no Muraji Iwamura, and IKUHA no Omi Makuhi to kill Prince Anahobe and Prince Yakabe as soon as possible.

sen.j: その日夜半、佐伯連丹經手らは穴穂部皇子の宮を囲んだ。
sen.e: That midnight, SAEKI no Muraji Nifute and other soldiers surrounded the palace of Prince Anahobe.
That midnight, SAEKI no Muraji Nifute and other soldiers surrounded the palace of Prince Anahobe.
That midnight, SAEKI no Muraji Nifute and other soldiers surrounded the palace of Prince Anahobe.

sen.j: 衛士は楼を登って、穴穂部皇子を襲い肩を斬った。
sen.e: Eji (a guard) climbed the tower and cut Prince Anahobe on the shoulder.
Eji (a guard) climbed the tower and cut Prince Anahobe on the shoulder.
Eji (a guard) climbed the tower and cut Prince Anahobe on the shoulder.

sen.j: 穴穂部皇子は楼から落ちて隣家へ走り入った。
sen.e: Prince Anahobe fell down from the tower and ran into the next house.
Prince Anahobe fell down from the tower and ran into the next house.
Prince Anahobe fell down from the tower and ran into the next house.

sen.j: 衞士らは灯をかかげて探し出して穴穂部皇子を殺した。
sen.e: Eji lit around, found him, and killed him.
Eji looked for him with lights and killed him.
sen.cmt: 文を自然にするため、全体を修正しました。
sen.e: Eji looked for him with lights and killed him.

sen.j: 翌8日、穴穂部皇子と仲が良かった宅部皇子も誅殺された。
sen.e: The next day, Prince Yakabe, who was close to Prince Anahobe, was also killed.
The next day, Prince Yakabe, who was close to Prince Anahobe, was also killed.
The next day, Prince Yakabe, who was close to Prince Anahobe, was also killed.

sen.j: 同年7月、馬子は諸皇子、諸氏族の大軍を派遣して、守屋を滅ぼした。
sen.e: In August, 587, Umako sent large force composed of princes and clans, and they killed Moriya.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。
sen.e: In August 587, Umako sent large forces composed of Princes and clans and killed Moriya.
sen.cmt: 文を自然にするため、一部修正しました。
sen.e: In August 587, Umako sent large forces composed of Princes and clans and killed Moriya.
